SEARCH
Module org.example.game
Package engine.save

Class SaveLoadManager

java.lang.Object
engine.save.SaveLoadManager
public class SaveLoadManager extends Object
Manages saving and loading of game state, including inventory, level index, and player position.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SaveLoadManager(Inventory inventory, Player player, LevelManager lvlMgr)
    Constructs a SaveLoadManager with required game components.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clearAll()
    Deletes all save files (inventory and savegame).
    boolean
    loadAll()
    Loads the full game state: inventory, level, and player position.
    void
    loadInventory()
    Loads the player's inventory from disk.
    void
    saveAll()
    Saves the full game state: inventory, current level, and player position.
    void

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SaveLoadManager

      public SaveLoadManager(Inventory inventory, Player player, LevelManager lvlMgr)
      Constructs a SaveLoadManager with required game components.
      Parameters:
      inventory - the player's inventory to save/load
      player - the player entity whose position is saved/loaded
      lvlMgr - the level manager for saving/loading level index

  • Method Details

    • saveInventory

      public void saveInventory()
      Saves the player's inventory to disk.

      Errors are logged to stderr on failure.

    • clearAll

      public void clearAll()
      Deletes all save files (inventory and savegame).

      Logs success or failure to standard output or stderr.

    • loadInventory

      public void loadInventory()
      Loads the player's inventory from disk.

      Errors are logged to stderr on failure.

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll()
      Saves the full game state: inventory, current level, and player position.

      Inventory is saved first, followed by writing level and coordinates to a properties file. Errors are logged to stderr on failure.

    • loadAll

      public boolean loadAll()
      Loads the full game state: inventory, level, and player position.

      Returns true if the save file existed and was loaded successfully; false otherwise.

      Returns:
      true if game state loaded successfully, false if no save exists or an error occurred
